title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 56 - Fines, Penalties And Forfeitures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 56 - Fines, Penalties And Forfeitures

State Regulations
§ 56.1 - Rotation in assignment of pilots
§ 56.2 - Penalty for failure by pilot to obey order
§ 56.3 - Penalty for neglect or refusal by Sandy Hook pilot to join pilot boat
§ 56.4 - Penalty for failure by Sandy Hook or Hell Gate pilot to board inward-bound vessel
§ 56.5 - Duty of master of vessel: safety of pilot; damages-penalty; delay boarding or leaving vessel-penalty; return of letters by pilot- nonliability
§ 56.6 - Fine or suspension for pilot's ommission or refusal to perform pilotage-connected duty
§ 56.7 - Fine for pilots carried to sea through negligence or lack of skill
§ 56.8 - Fine or suspension for pilot's noncompliance with regulations of the Federal government for the use of Ambrose or other channels or areas
§ 56.9 - Anchoring vessel elsewhere than on officially designated anchorage ground within waters of Port of New York; prohibition of pilots-fine or suspension
§ 56.10 - Vessel's going aground or other accident to be reported to secretary by pilot; fine for violation
§ 56.11 - Destruction or mutilation by pilot of official or authorized postings in pilot office, shore station or pilot boat; fine or suspension
§ 56.12 - Unofficial use by pilot of name of pilot organization or board prohibited; fine
§ 56.13 - Use of abusive or insulting language or threatening conduct by pilot; suspension or revocation of license
§ 56.14 - Conduct of pilots-fine and/or suspension or revocation of license; drunkenness; incurring debts; disorderly conduct
§ 56.15 - Membership in or association with unapproved pilotage organization prohibited; forfeiture of pilot's license
§ 56.16 - Imposition of costs against complainant or respondent
§ 56.17 - Payment of fines to be made to board
§ 56.18 - Penalty for failure by Sandy Hook pilot to obtain signed order
§ 56.19 - Chemical/substance abuse

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 56

Statutory authority: Navigation Law, §95

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
